intro: Calyptranthes costata, commonly known as the serrated calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a serrated edge, giving it its common name. Calyptranthes costata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
